    • Method Detail

      • getSugarspace

        public static SugarSpace_ch2 getSugarspace()

        We need to enforce that only one SugarSpace object will be created. We are using the Singleton design pattern. This method is the only valid method to access this single object. Since it is static, one has to call SugarSpace_ch2.getInstance() to get this object.

        Before calling this method, you have to create the singleton object by calling #createInstance . If this has not been done, a RuntimeException is thrown. This is

        Returns:
        the instantiated Sugarspace object. If it has not been created yet, it throws a RuntimeException
        See Also:
        createInstance
